UC will offer free tuition to Native American students. But not all are included

The University of California system will fully cover in-state tuition fees for California residents who are members of federally recognized tribes starting this fall, UC President Michael Drake announced. But the program does not apply to the 55 non-federally recognized tribes in the state.

COVID in California: Bay Area infections up 110% in 1 month, most since mid-February

The number of Americans who have lost their lives to COVID-19 is edging closer to 1 million. As of Tuesday evening, the death toll stood at 991,572, according to tracking by Johns Hopkins University, although daily deaths are no longer at the highs of pandemic surges. In California, 89,255 people have died COVID-caused deaths.
